title: address book synchronization thunderbird (with morefunctionsforaddressbook addon) <-> owncloud not fully possible / redundant
body:
### expected behaviour
what concerns the thunderbird address book (with installed morefunctionsforaddressbook addon) all fields available in the thunderbird address book should be synchronized with owncloud, in a way, that they also appear in owncloud and vice-versa.

### actual behaviour

examples:

1.
when using groups in owncloud a fully new tab in the thunderbird address book appears, despite thunderbird having its own category system (provided by morefunctionsforadressbook).

2.
when using the additional e-mail address fields in thunderbird (through the morefunctionsforaddressbook addon) they get not reflected in owncloud.

### steps to reproduce
1. install owncloud server-side
2. install thunderbird client-side with addons (inverse sogo connector and morefunctionsforaddressbook)
3. in thunderbird create a remote addressbook and connect it with owncloud (through the carddav link provided by owncloud)
4. create an example conctact, either in thunderbird or owncloud
5. synchronize
6. in owncloud: assign the contact to a group (or several)
7. in thunderbird: assign the contact to several categories (system available through morefunctionsforaddressbook addon)
8. in thunderbird: use the additional e-mail fields to enter several e-mail addresses (possibility given through morefunctionsforaddressbook addon)
9. synchronize
10. compare the conacts (no full synchronization occurs, respectively what concerns the categories / groups, there's now redundancy in thunderbird)

### server configuration
operating system:
centos release 6.4 (final)

web server: 
apache/2.2.15 (unix)

database:
sqlite 3.6.20

php version:
php 5.3.3

owncloud version:
owncloud-5.0.5-19.1

### client configuration

operating system:
debian 6

thunderbird:
thunderbird 17.0.2
inverse sogo connector 17.0.5 (addon)
morefunctionsforaddressbook 0.6.8.2 (addon)
